alert.note: Alert for Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 08 at 8:08PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Torrance. This includes the Estancia valley. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has fallen over much of the Estancia valley. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen within the last hour and soaking rainfall of 1 to 4 inches has been observed within the last 24 hours. This will lead to significant ponding of water in low lying areas and possible arroyo and creek flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriarty, Estancia and McIntosh. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 194 and 201.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
